thread.title: Defying US Warnings, Israel Unleashes Fury on Beirut, Claims Another Hezbollah Commander
thread.title_full: Defying US Warnings, Israel Unleashes Fury on Beirut, Claims Another Hezbollah Commander

author: newsdirectory3
title: Defying US Warnings, Israel Unleashes Fury on Beirut, Claims Another Hezbollah Commander
text:
Israel Resumes Offensive in Beirut, ⁤Kills ‌Hezbollah Commander Israel’s military‌ campaign in Beirut continues, with another Hezbollah commander killed in​ recent airstrikes, despite calls ‌for a ceasefire from the US and other ⁣ allied nations .
Recent Developments On September 26, 2024, the Israel Defense Forces‍ (IDF) confirmed⁤ that their aircraft​ had ​launched ⁣an⁣ airstrike in southern Beirut, resulting in the death‍ of Muhammad⁤ Hussein Surour, the head of Hezbollah’s air strike unit .
The IDF stated that Surur had been a member of Hezbollah⁢ since the 1980s and had been involved​ in several terrorist attacks​ against Israelis and IDF‍ soldiers, utilizing drones and other explosives.
According to the​ Israeli prime minister’s office, Benjamin Netanyahu approved the assassination attempt while en⁣ route to ⁣New‌ York City to attend⁢ the United Nations General Assembly.
Ongoing ⁤Conflict Israel ‍launched‌ a major attack in Lebanon on Monday, September 23, and has continued its military‌ campaign⁢ throughout the week. The recent airstrikes have resulted in ⁣at least ‌26 fatalities, ⁢bringing the total death toll to over 600.
Prime Minister Netanyahu has instructed the Israeli army to fight with all its might in Lebanon, disregarding ⁣calls from⁢ 12 allied nations, including⁤ the US ⁤and the UK, for‍ a 21-day ceasefire.
Key Facts Israel’s military campaign in Lebanon has resulted in‍ over‌ 600‍ fatalities. The recent ‌airstrikes have killed at least 26 people. Hezbollah commander Muhammad Hussein Surour⁣ was killed in the airstrike. Prime ⁤Minister Netanyahu has approved the assassination attempt and instructed the Israeli army to fight with all its might.
